13  package org.cesecore.certificates.ocsp.cache;
14  
15  import java.math.BigInteger;
16  import java.security.cert.CertificateEncodingException;
17  import java.security.cert.X509Certificate;
18  import java.util.ArrayList;
19  import java.util.Collection;
20  import java.util.HashMap;
21  import java.util.List;
22  import java.util.Map;
23  import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
24  import org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils;
25  import org.apache.log4j.Logger;
26  import org.bouncycastle.asn1.nist.NISTObjectIdentifiers;
27  import org.bouncycastle.asn1.oiw.OIWObjectIdentifiers;
28  import org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.AlgorithmIdentifier;
29  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.CertificateID;
30  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.OCSPException;
31  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.jcajce.JcaCertificateID;
32  import org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException;
33  import org.bouncycastle.operator.bc.BcDigestCalculatorProvider;
34  import org.cesecore.certificates.ocsp.exception.OcspFailureException;
35  import org.cesecore.util.CertTools;
36  
37  /**
38   * Hold information needed to create OCSP responses without database lookups.
39   *
40   * @version $Id: OcspSigningCache.java 28643 2018-04-06 08:53:57Z samuellb $
41   */
42  public enum OcspSigningCache {
43      /** Singleton instance. */
44    INSTANCE;
45  
46      /** Cache. */
47    private Map<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry> cache =
48        new HashMap<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry>();
49    /** Staging. */
50    private Map<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry> staging =
51        new HashMap<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry>();
52    /** Default. */
53    private OcspSigningCacheEntry defaultResponderCacheEntry = null;
54    /** Lock. */
55    private final ReentrantLock lock = new ReentrantLock(false);
56    /** Logger. */
57    private static final Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger(OcspSigningCache.class);
58    /** Flag to detect and log non-existence of a default responder once. */
59    private boolean logDefaultHasRunOnce = false;
60  
61    /**
62     * @param certID ID
63     * @return Entry
64     */
65    public OcspSigningCacheEntry getEntry(final CertificateID certID) {
66      return cache.get(getCacheIdFromCertificateID(certID));
67    }
68  
69    /**
70     * @return the entry corresponding to the default responder, or null if it
71     *     wasn't found.
72     */
73    public OcspSigningCacheEntry getDefaultEntry() {
74      return defaultResponderCacheEntry;
75    }
76  
77    /**
78     * WARNING: This method potentially exports references to CAs private keys!
79     *
80     * @return entries
81     */
82    public Collection<OcspSigningCacheEntry> getEntries() {
83      return cache.values();
84    }
85  
86    /** Start. */
87    public void stagingStart() {
88      lock.lock();
89      staging = new HashMap<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry>();
90    }
91  
92    /**
93     * @param ocspSigningCacheEntry Entry
94     */
95    public void stagingAdd(final OcspSigningCacheEntry ocspSigningCacheEntry) {
96      List<CertificateID> certIDs = ocspSigningCacheEntry.getCertificateID();
97      for (CertificateID certID : certIDs) {
98        staging.put(getCacheIdFromCertificateID(certID), ocspSigningCacheEntry);
99      }
100   }
101 
102   /**
103    * @param defaultResponderSubjectDn DN
104    */
105   public void stagingCommit(final String defaultResponderSubjectDn) {
106     OcspSigningCacheEntry lDefaultResponderCacheEntry = null;
107     for (final OcspSigningCacheEntry entry : staging.values()) {
108       if (entry.getOcspSigningCertificate() != null) {
109         final X509Certificate signingCertificate =
110             entry.getOcspSigningCertificate();
111         if (CertTools.getIssuerDN(signingCertificate)
112             .equals(defaultResponderSubjectDn)) {
113           lDefaultResponderCacheEntry = entry;
114           break;
115         }
116       } else if (entry.getCaCertificateChain() != null
117           && !entry.getCaCertificateChain().isEmpty()) {
118         final X509Certificate signingCertificate =
119             entry.getCaCertificateChain().get(0);
120         if (CertTools.getSubjectDN(signingCertificate)
121             .equals(defaultResponderSubjectDn)) {
122           lDefaultResponderCacheEntry = entry;
123           break;
124         }
125       }
126     }
127     // Lastly, walk through the list of entries and replace all placeholders
128     // with the default responder
129     Map<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry> modifiedEntries =
130         new HashMap<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry>();
131     List<Integer> removedEntries = new ArrayList<Integer>();
132     for (Integer key : staging.keySet()) {
133       OcspSigningCacheEntry entry = staging.get(key);
134       // If entry has been created without a private key, replace it with the
135       // default responder.
136       if (entry.isPlaceholder()) {
137         if (lDefaultResponderCacheEntry != null) {
138           entry =
139               new OcspSigningCacheEntry(
140                   entry.getIssuerCaCertificate(),
141                   entry.getIssuerCaCertificateStatus(),
142                   lDefaultResponderCacheEntry.getCaCertificateChain(),
143                   lDefaultResponderCacheEntry.getOcspSigningCertificate(),
144                   lDefaultResponderCacheEntry.getPrivateKey(),
145                   lDefaultResponderCacheEntry.getSignatureProviderName(),
146                   lDefaultResponderCacheEntry.getOcspKeyBinding(),
147                   lDefaultResponderCacheEntry.getResponderIdType());
148           modifiedEntries.put(key, entry);
149         } else {
150           // If no default responder is defined, remove placeholder.
151           removedEntries.add(key);
152         }
153       }
154     }
155     staging.putAll(modifiedEntries);
156     for (Integer removedKey : removedEntries) {
157       staging.remove(removedKey);
158     }
159     logDefaultResponderChanges(
160         this.defaultResponderCacheEntry,
161         lDefaultResponderCacheEntry,
162         defaultResponderSubjectDn);
163     cache = staging;
164     this.defaultResponderCacheEntry = lDefaultResponderCacheEntry;
165     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
166       LOG.debug("Committing the following to OCSP cache:");
167       for (final Integer key : staging.keySet()) {
168         final OcspSigningCacheEntry entry = staging.get(key);
169         LOG.debug(
170             " KeyBindingId: "
171                 + key
172                 + ", SubjectDN '"
173                 + CertTools.getSubjectDN(entry.getFullCertificateChain().get(0))
174                 + "', IssuerDN '"
175                 + CertTools.getIssuerDN(entry.getFullCertificateChain().get(0))
176                 + "', SerialNumber "
177                 + entry
178                     .getFullCertificateChain()
179                     .get(0)
180                     .getSerialNumber()
181                     .toString()
182                 + "/"
183                 + entry
184                     .getFullCertificateChain()
185                     .get(0)
186                     .getSerialNumber()
187                     .toString(16));
188         if (entry.getOcspKeyBinding() != null) {
189           LOG.debug(
190               "   keyPairAlias: "
191                   + entry.getOcspKeyBinding().getKeyPairAlias());
192         }
193       }
194     }
195   }
196 
197   /** Unlock. */
198   public void stagingRelease() {
199     lock.unlock();
200   }
201 
202   /**
203    * Log any change in default responder.
204    *
205    * @param currentEntry current entry
206    * @param stagedEntry staged entry
207    * @param defaultResponderSubjectDn boolean
208    */
209   private void logDefaultResponderChanges(
210       final OcspSigningCacheEntry currentEntry,
211       final OcspSigningCacheEntry stagedEntry,
212       final String defaultResponderSubjectDn) {
213     String msg = null;
214     if (stagedEntry == null
215         && (currentEntry != null || !logDefaultHasRunOnce)) {
216       // No default responder after staging. Did we loose it or is it the first
217       // time we run this check?
218       if (StringUtils.isEmpty(defaultResponderSubjectDn)) {
219         msg = "No default responder was defined.";
220       } else {
221         msg =
222             "The default OCSP responder with subject '"
223                 + defaultResponderSubjectDn
224                 + "' was not found.";
225       }
226       msg +=
227           " OCSP requests for certificates issued by unknown CAs will return"
228               + " \"unauthorized\" as per RFC6960, Section 2.3";
229     } else if (stagedEntry != null && currentEntry == null) {
230       // We gained a default responder.
231       if (stagedEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()) {
232         msg =
233             "Setting keybinding with ID"
234                 + stagedEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId()
235                 + " and DN "
236                 + defaultResponderSubjectDn
237                 + " as default OCSP responder.";
238       } else {
239         msg =
240             "Setting CA with DN "
241                 + defaultResponderSubjectDn
242                 + " as default OCSP responder.";
243       }
244     } else if (stagedEntry != null && currentEntry != null) {
245       // We have a default responder both before and after. Did it change in any
246       // way?
247       if (stagedEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()
248               != currentEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()
249           || !CertTools.getSubjectDN(stagedEntry.getIssuerCaCertificate())
250               .equals(
251                   CertTools.getSubjectDN(
252                       currentEntry.getIssuerCaCertificate()))) {
253         // We switched from signing with a CA to OcspKeyBindinig or vice versa,
254         // or use a different default.
255         if (stagedEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()) {
256           msg =
257               "Setting keybinding with ID"
258                   + stagedEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId()
259                   + " and DN "
260                   + defaultResponderSubjectDn
261                   + " as default OCSP responder.";
262         } else {
263           msg =
264               "Setting CA with DN "
265                   + defaultResponderSubjectDn
266                   + " as default OCSP responder.";
267         }
268       } else if (stagedEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()) {
269         if (stagedEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId()
270             != currentEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId()) {
271           // A different OcspKeyBinding will be used to respond to requests even
272           // though the issuing CA has not changed
273           msg =
274               "Setting keybinding with ID"
275                   + stagedEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId()
276                   + " and DN "
277                   + defaultResponderSubjectDn
278                   + " as default OCSP responder.";
279         }
280       }
281     }
282     if (msg == null) {
283       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
284         LOG.debug("No change in default responder.");
285       }
286     } else {
287       LOG.info(msg);
288     }
289     logDefaultHasRunOnce = true;
290   }
291 
292   /**
293    * This method will add a single cache entry to the cache. It should only be
294    * used to solve temporary cache inconsistencies.
295    *
296    * @param ocspSigningCacheEntry the entry to add
297    */
298   public void addSingleEntry(
299           final OcspSigningCacheEntry ocspSigningCacheEntry) {
300     List<CertificateID> certIDs = ocspSigningCacheEntry.getCertificateID();
301     for (CertificateID certID : certIDs) {
302       int cacheId = getCacheIdFromCertificateID(certID);
303       lock.lock();
304       try {
305         // Make sure that another thread didn't add the same entry while this
306         // one was waiting.
307         if (!cache.containsKey(cacheId)) {
308           cache.put(cacheId, ocspSigningCacheEntry);
309         }
310       } finally {
311         lock.unlock();
312       }
313     }
314   }
315 
316   /**
317    * @param certID ID
318    * @return a cache identifier based on the provided CertificateID.
319    */
320   public static int getCacheIdFromCertificateID(final CertificateID certID) {
321     // Use bitwise XOR of the hashcodes for IssuerNameHash and IssuerKeyHash to
322     // produce the integer.
323     int result =
324         new BigInteger(certID.getIssuerNameHash()).hashCode()
325             ^ new BigInteger(certID.getIssuerKeyHash()).hashCode();
326     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
327       LOG.debug(
328           "Using getIssuerNameHash "
329               + new BigInteger(certID.getIssuerNameHash()).toString(16)
330               + " and getIssuerKeyHash "
331               + new BigInteger(certID.getIssuerKeyHash()).toString(16)
332               + " to produce id "
333               + result);
334     }
335     return result;
336   }
337 
338   /**
339    * @param certificate certificate
340    * @return the CertificateID's based on the provided certificate
341    */
342   public static List<CertificateID> getCertificateIDFromCertificate(
343       final X509Certificate certificate) {
344     try {
345       if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
346         LOG.trace(
347             "Building CertificateId's from certificate with subjectDN '"
348                 + CertTools.getSubjectDN(certificate)
349                 + "'.");
350       }
351       List<CertificateID> ret = new ArrayList<CertificateID>();
352       ret.add(
353           new JcaCertificateID(
354               new BcDigestCalculatorProvider()
355                   .get(new AlgorithmIdentifier(OIWObjectIdentifiers.idSHA1)),
356               certificate,
357               certificate.getSerialNumber()));
358       ret.add(
359           new JcaCertificateID(
360               new BcDigestCalculatorProvider()
361                   .get(
362                       new AlgorithmIdentifier(NISTObjectIdentifiers.id_sha256)),
363               certificate,
364               certificate.getSerialNumber()));
365       return ret;
366     } catch (OCSPException e) {
367       throw new OcspFailureException(e);
368     } catch (CertificateEncodingException e) {
369       throw new OcspFailureException(e);
370     } catch (OperatorCreationException e) {
371       throw new OcspFailureException(e);
372     }
373   }
374 }
